description: A Bash script for deploying and initializing a PostgreSQL database server, including setup of user permissions, database creation, server startup, and environment configuration.

methods.name: echo
methods.description: Print messages to the terminal for status updates and information.

methods.name: ls
methods.description: List directories/files to find PostgreSQL version.

methods.name: sudo
methods.description: Execute commands as the postgres user for database operations.

methods.name: pg_isready
methods.description: Check if PostgreSQL is already running on the specified port.

methods.name: pgrep
methods.description: Detect existing PostgreSQL processes by port.

methods.name: psql
methods.description: Interact with PostgreSQL to execute commands, create databases, set permissions.

methods.name: initdb
methods.description: Initialize a new PostgreSQL data directory if it doesn't exist.
